fullText: Yoḥannan bar Zoʿbi https://gedsh.bethmardutho.org/Yohannan-bar-Zobi http://syriaca.org/bibl/607 598 http://syriaca.org/person/823 person Learned monk and author. (12th/13th cent. ) [Ch. of E.] Learned monk and author. He studied under Shemʿon Shanqlawi and was a monk of the famous monastery of Beth Qoqa in Adiabene ; his fame as a scholar was such that he attracted pupils also from the Syr. Orth. Church, among them Yaʿqub bar Shakko . He was the author of an important grammar (unpublished) and a number of verse works on philosophy and on liturgy. His theological compendium Zqorā mlaḥḥmā (‘Well-woven fabric’) exists in several mss. and is quoted in later E.-Syr. literature. Primary Sources J.  Isaac, ‘Le baptême et le levain sacré par Johannan bar Zoʿbi’, Bayn al-Nahrayn 16 (61–2) (1988), 108–31.
